title: What champions tilt you personally?
body:
Just to clarify, **the champion doesn't even have to be strong or OP.**

Everyone has a few champions that just tilt them. Even if they have clear weaknesses and regardless if they're strong in the current meta.

I'll start with mine:

{{champion:45}}: I know, **I know.** He's an immobile mage that gets one spell rotation off in a team fight. I get it. But that feeling getting caught in his  cage and knowing you're about to be 100-0'd by a 2/4/3 Veigar tilts me. I honestly think it has to do with his point and click nuke of an ult more than anything. Tilted me even more when his ult scaled with **your** AP. He has weaknesses, I know. Doesn't mean he doesn't tilt me though

{{champion:23}}: Yes, "lots of champs counter him". But if you don't counter him, its miserable. Starting off with the RNG crits from the very start. Try to trade with him and get crit twice without any crit items. **Tilted.** Its not like Jhin or Cait when you know their crit is up. It's just random. Absolutely nothing you can do to predict or play around it. Even if you dominate him in lane, he will eventually get to a point where you need to send at least two people to deal with him. Leave him alone in lane for 1 minute and he takes two towers. Yes, he's horrible in team fights. Yes, he's weak to CC. Yes, some niche top laners can kite him into oblivion. Still tilts me.

How about you?

replies.body: {{champion:157}}
Fuck that guy. You used to be able to wreck him with tanky top laners. Now he plows through anyone.
Legit just got nerfed, and that sounds like a "you" problem.
Bruiser Yasuo got nerfed. Regular Yasuo got buffed with that huge AS buff.
It's not really huge. Base gets buffed, nerfed scaling. He's a champ that's more orientated to the late game so it's a nerf.

A champ orientated to lategame who gets lategame dmg after 2 items.
Logic not found.

Yasuo is so weak! You can beat him so easy. Just send your whole team to the lane to gank him, build your entire composition around him, and  sacrifice your first new born. So easy to counter, haha EZ see.
-Every yasuo player trying to justify his overloaded kit

7 months ago


what you're saying doesn't even respond to the point I made. 7 months ago.
My list is too long

{{champion:81}} 
If I see this on my team I am instantly tilted.
"Why would you pick _that_ adc? He doesn't deal any damage. Please let me adc... my late game carries actually deal **damage**"
Useless piece of trash...
You don't pick Ez for late game damage, maybe that adc prefers mid game power spikes?

His mid game power spike is very determinant on him getting fed early. And lets face it; most ezreals suck and won't get fed early (well from my exp anyway :/). Even so; most other adcs will have stronger teamfights even when he hits that "power spike". 

I've seen some badass ezreals, but the majority of them just can't quite make it work.

I'm a rather cocky player, so I will forget that i only have Tear and boots and try to engage 2v2 fights. Usually I lose. There isn't a single laning phase where I don't die at least once. The thing is that, just by farming a bit to get {{item:3025}} {{item:3042}}, normally at the 20-25 minute mark,  you suddenly outdamage everyone, and then you snowball. Then it's super easy to maintain pressure due to the immense safety and damage output Ez provides, and even 6-items-late-game, only hypercarries outscale him, even though he is considered a mid game champion.

That is jsut my experience as Ez, I don't have that many games (only 30k points)

Guess my opinion is kind of skewed (Twitch main and all)....
He still seems underwhelming compared to a lot of adcs in teamfights in my experience. Sure, he can have some nice damage and keep safe; but there are so many other adcs that are done killing everything by the time he's trolled around with a few Qs and Es. Again: Twitch main, so my "fights" tend to be like 2-3 seconds of murdering everything instantly ^^

I guess your preference is damage, Ezreal has less damage but way more safety and some utility as well.
Different playstyles xp
Exactly. I cringe when I have to buy _defenses_ on my adc ;)
Try playing mid against a {{champion:26}}
He used to tilt the shit out of me when his bombs were point and click

{{champion:105}}  tilts me

Singed can GTFO.

I feel like he's super trolly. He *wants* to attract map attention, so if jg/mid try to deal with him they'll probably get flipped and not actually succeed, and on the other hand if you ignore him, he'll just proxy farm until he's huge and/or objectives fall, so it's lose lose.

Meanwhile I'm down in bot lane more or less powerless to do anything involving him until way late, and even then I'm probably just following adc around.

I wonder what they have in common...might be the ability to zone while being resourceless and with low cds...but maybe not.

And bitch knocks you away and with her tumble... if you ain't kassadin, good fucking luck touching her. And if you reach her you're prolly fucking dead.

{{champion:157}} 
It doesn't matter if it's release Yasuo, Tanksuo or if he's got the same play rate as freaking Urgot. I can't stand this champion. His endless dashes in lane, his obnoxious wind wall, constant crits, a shield that is just there to be annoying as f*ck and a huge armor pen. bonus for FIFTEEN GOD DAMN SECONDS!

And don't even get me started on the Yasuos on my own team! hint: I've never seen them perform well.

_/rant_

Fun fact: I'm level 5 Yasuo with a level 6 mastery token
.
.
.
.
.
.
~~Help m~~ **_HASAKI!_**
At least his huge free armor pen isn't a constant passive effect anymore.
Nah, just on all of his crits, which he only has 100% of the time ~~:)~~
With a much squishier build, which was the plan all along.

{{champion:105}}  full cdr
Cancer

I get tilted by quite a lot of champions so here we go

{{champion:412}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:39}} 

**Thresh**: most picked support, really boring to play against, and his kit is fairly strong
**Nautilus**: So much CC, targeted ult that also CC's you and he can still dish out hella dmg on squishies
**Ahri**: her playstyle triggers me
**Malzahar**: i used to play him, but i need to admitt, he's as skill lacking as a champ can be. I hate point and click CC and his passive makes it worse
**LeBlanc**: The team syndrome, faker mechanics lvl 7 Le Blanc on enemy team, bronze 4 leblonk on your time. And god don't get me started on her kit
**Lee Sin**: His Q triggers me
**Morgana**: She's not all that bad as support, but ever laned against a morgana midlane? She basically just ignores any DPS because her passive + W on minions allow her to heal so easily. Try to engage on her? Q/R. Want to CC or burst her? Shield.
**Nasus**: Disgusting slow, but the worst about him in my opinion is his free 20% lifesteal passive. Rework that shit into something healthy and not just a ball of stats
**Talon**: If i had to pick a champion who tilted me the most in the past it'd be this guy
**Twisted Fate**: They really need to nerf his W duration or CD, he can zone you from creeps with it basically 24/7 seeing as it's an undodgeable stun and his Q goes right through minions
**Vi**: Ult is disgusting imo, can't CC her during it, can't dodge it. insanely strong ganking tool
**Irelia**: I hate her kit, it's so overloaded. Dash that can reset cd and refund mana, heal and true dmg on basic attack, stun/slow on E which is toxic AF because her E basically punishes you for getting her on low HP, and free elo heal on ult


"Where's yasuo??"
well not in my games for sure. Always ban him
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I am a top and support player. 

My list is pretty short. I can't stand {{champion:114}}. She is one of the few champions I can kill multiple times in the top lane and still out duel me an I play {{champion:75}}. Just so annoying with her dashes and slows. 

{{champion:53}} he is one of the only champions in the game that complete alters the dynamics of the game. A blitz crank can miss hooks all game, but if he lands one important one it can be game. He is actually my go too ban because if the bot lane cant dodge grabs it can turn into a disaster. If I don't know who to ban, I always ban him.

{{champion:245}} just because of his hyper mobility. He is difficult to kill, has a lot of CC and can make positioning mistakes and ult to get away. I can't stand how he can build tank or ap and still do massive damage with a hyper mobile kit.

I hate {{champion:41}} for a lot of the same reasons. Hyper mobile, deals a lot of damage and a global ultimate that is incredibly strong and hard to play around.
